question: Which of the following clearly define the Line of Credit loans?
option1: It is start-up loans allowing businesses to open.
option2: It allows businesses to borrow money from a lender at any given time, up to a certain amount of
option3: It is the simplest type of corporate loans.
option4: It is made so businesses can buy property.
answer: It allows businesses to borrow money from a lender at any given time, up to a certain amount of
explanation: Line of credit loans allow businesses to borrow money from a lender at any given time, up to a certain amount of money per year. This is a common arrangement if the business has varying profits from month to month and may need extra funds to cover expenses at certain times.
